org.apache.hadoop.security

Class SaslRpcClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.security.SaslRpcClient

  • @InterfaceAudience.LimitedPrivate(value={"HDFS","MapReduce"})
@InterfaceStability.Evolving
public class SaslRpcClient
extends Object
    A utility class that encapsulates SASL logic for RPC client

public SaslRpcServer.AuthMethod getAuthMethod()

      • selectSaslClient

        private RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslAuth selectSaslClient(List<RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslAuth> authTypes)
                                                        throws SaslException,
                                                               AccessControlException,
                                                               IOException
        Instantiate a sasl client for the first supported auth type in the given list. The auth type must be defined, enabled, and the user must possess the required credentials, else the next auth is tried.
        Parameters:
        authTypes - to attempt in the given order
        Returns:
        SaslAuth of instantiated client
        Throws:
        AccessControlException - - client doesn't support any of the auths
        IOException - - misc errors
        SaslException

      • isValidAuthType

        private boolean isValidAuthType(RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslAuth authType)

      • createSaslClient

        private SaslClient createSaslClient(RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslAuth authType)
                             throws SaslException,
                                    IOException
        Try to create a SaslClient for an authentication type. May return null if the type isn't supported or the client lacks the required credentials.
        Parameters:
        authType - - the requested authentication method
        Returns:
        SaslClient for the authType or null
        Throws:
        SaslException - - error instantiating client
        IOException - - misc errors

      • getServerToken

        private Token<?> getServerToken(RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslAuth authType)
                         throws IOException
        Try to locate the required token for the server.
        Parameters:
        authType - of the SASL client
        Returns:
        Token for server, or null if no token available
        Throws:
        IOException - - token selector cannot be instantiated

      • getServerPrincipal

        String getServerPrincipal(RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslAuth authType)
                    throws IOException
        Get the remote server's principal. The value will be obtained from the config and cross-checked against the server's advertised principal.
        Parameters:
        authType - of the SASL client
        Returns:
        String of the server's principal
        Throws:
        IOException - - error determining configured principal

                                     throws IOException
        Do client side SASL authentication with server via the given InputStream and OutputStream
        Parameters:
        inS - InputStream to use
        outS - OutputStream to use
        Returns:

      • saslEvaluateToken

        private byte[] saslEvaluateToken(RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto saslResponse,
                       boolean serverIsDone)
                          throws SaslException
        Evaluate the server provided challenge. The server must send a token if it's not done. If the server is done, the challenge token is optional because not all mechanisms send a final token for the client to update its internal state. The client must also be done after evaluating the optional token to ensure a malicious server doesn't prematurely end the negotiation with a phony success.
        Parameters:
        saslResponse - - client response to challenge
        serverIsDone - - server negotiation state
        Throws:
        SaslException - - any problems with negotiation

      • createSaslReply

        private RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.Builder createSaslReply(RpcHeaderProtos.RpcSaslProto.SaslState state,
                                                   byte[] responseToken)

      • useWrap

        private boolean useWrap()

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream(InputStream in)
                           throws IOException
        Get SASL wrapped InputStream if SASL QoP requires unwrapping, otherwise return original stream. Can be called only after saslConnect() has been called.
        Parameters:
        in - - InputStream used to make the connection
        Returns:
        InputStream that may be using SASL unwrap
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream(OutputStream out)
                             throws IOException
        Get SASL wrapped OutputStream if SASL QoP requires wrapping, otherwise return original stream. Can be called only after saslConnect() has been called.
        Parameters:
        in - - InputStream used to make the connection
        Returns:
        InputStream that may be using SASL unwrap
        Throws:
        IOException
